website_summaries.verdict: Highly-rated tap handle for your home kegerator.
pros: Chrome finish provides a professional feel
Easy to install and beer pours are easy flowing
You can't go wrong with this handle for this price point
cons: Plastic handle isn't as durable as a stainless steel version

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, excellant price, prefect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: these are awesome. I've been using mine regulary and have not had any problem like others have. I do however keep a spray bottle of starsan on top of my fridge and when I'm finished for the day I spray it in the faucet and use a brush and caps. I also keep a spare keg with sanitizer in it and run it thru the lines when finished with keg. I would recommend these and buy them again. Also the tail piece is permently attached to the shank and fits 3/16 ID beer lines.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for my application. Arrived quickly and nicely packaged. Seems to be solid construction. I have not had the leaking or sticking issues others have wrote about. It is still working perfect after about ten gallons thru it. Will be buying another. Update: just purchased my second one of these. First one has had about 25 gallons through it and is still working perfectly after 2.5 months. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: butz

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pair of these set up on my kegorator for a few weeks and couldn't be happier. They don't leak or stick, just pour perfect pints. I almost went with more expensive ones but glad I went with these.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent faucet.
customer_reviews.text: This faucet works just fine for my six tap keezer for my home brew. I have one odd tap that starts with a P but this one is every bit it's equal or better and you can't beat the price. This is easy to take a part and clean and pours just fine. I would recommend highly over the higher priced taps.
customer_reviews.author: Jim bec

customer_reviews.title: Leaking after 1 keg
customer_reviews.text: It's leaking after 1 keg, on keg 2 (1/2 barrels). Have to firmly place it back into place to stop it from leaking. Nuts are tight. I wouldn't buy it again. It also spins, but that could be my particular installation.... or not.... I've tightened it fully but it still spins, maybe I'm a noob, but not sure.
customer_reviews.author: The dude

customer_reviews.title: Machined threads are sharp
customer_reviews.text: Cut my fingers, maybe I should have used gloves, when threading the nut onto the faucet. But perhaps a bit more care in the manufacturing process would have saved me from a series of paper-cut like wounds. But it does the job and is a good backup when I switch kegs so I can clean the other one.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Does well for what it is. Not a high end faucet, but for mini kegerator purpose, just fine. Does drip a little after pulling a glass, but at price point, not really an issue.Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bastug

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was needing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these taps to build out an old fridge into a kegerator. The install was only tricky because there were no clear instruction as to the size of the hole to drill out, but otherwise super simple. I've not had any leaks from them and they look good.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Thomason

customer_reviews.title: Pulls on a little to easily for my liking
customer_reviews.text: It works fine so far. The handle pulls super easily, which some might prefer, but to me feels flimsy and cheap. I feel like it could get bumped and turn on accidentally. I prefer my other taps which provide a little more resistance to the tap pull. Otherwise it is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Great for Keezer
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my Keezer build. Works great, only thing i wish it had was an auto off feature.Pours well can drip a little when stopped but what tap doesnt really unless it has the internal spring to ensure it closes entirely.
customer_reviews.author: CDaniels

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Needed an extra faucet and shank for a last minute mobile wedding bar, and this fit the bill perfectly. Good quality, and no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: crazyjake

customer_reviews.title: Basic handle, cost effective shank and faucet
customer_reviews.text: Keezer build. Good shank and faucet kit. Handle is super basic plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Dykstra

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!! Some quality
customer_reviews.text: I will post a pic once I have a good one. These are absolutely perfect for diy people such as myself. They are idiot proof and very adaptable so far seem sturdy. I just hope they dont rust or corrode
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rella

customer_reviews.title: Dual taps make it easier to double fist
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting so ripped thanks to my dual taps. Ratchets be all up in my crib now asking what's on tap and I've never failed to deliver. Great quality too. The taps are also nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chulo

customer_reviews.title: Not what I Ordered
customer_reviews.text: Not what I Ordered.... I received a tap for something else, not a 4 inch shank and no handle. The box it came in is labeled correctly.
customer_reviews.author: D Stake

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says on the can. For the price it's good. Delivered as promised really easy to install. Be sure to have a faucet tap wrench to connect the shank to the faucet!!! The only real criticism I have is that the action of the handle doesn't have a strong detent. You can accidentally knock or nudge it lightly without realising and it will start flowing so, I wouldn't recommend it be used in a space with a lot of foot traffic passing by. This is a minor bug for the price you're paying for it. I'll be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: onemanscave

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: I have not installed these yet but I am happy with the quality of the product as received. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: They are OK
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think they’re the best time, but hey they work for what they were intended
customer_reviews.author: Devlin Howieson

customer_reviews.title: Was some slight damage when I got the product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in the box was damaged and one of the beauty rings was plastic busted but other than that works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No leaks
customer_reviews.text: It keeps the beer in the keg until you want it to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepawake

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more?
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery, looks great, works exactly as promised... this tap is a fabulous value.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Chambers

customer_reviews.title: They work great so far
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these on my kegerator for a couple months now. They work great so far. I've never used the Perlicks so I can't compare but these ones are just fine, and cheaper of course. I know some people say that they stick or whatever but I also got some of those faucet caps and just cap it up when I'm done for the night, have not had any sticking issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Burrell, II

customer_reviews.title: They dry and stick closed.
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these now sitting in a drawer that have been replaced by another brand tap faucets with rear seals. These taps do the job, but if gone unused for a day, the beer inside drys and sticks due to the design. I suggest spend the money and get the better, rear sealing tap faucets.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: It's a beer tap!  Works fine, looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: There are higher-end styles of these because they tend to stick if you haven't used them in awhile but it's not a big deal. Great looking beer tap for my homemade kegerator.
customer_reviews.author: Michael MTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: It's not all about size...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, although 4" is a bit excessive in length - you're gonna have issues with a 5gal corney in a kegerator with this, but dang it was easy to assemble and works AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: The Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my new kegerator
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my new kegerator. I was worried about not splashing out for the Perlick taps, but this one works great. 3-4 drips after I pour a glass of beer, has never stuck even after a week of sitting there with beer in it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest faucet/shank set on here. Works great with my kegerator
customer_reviews.author: Seth D. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: We bought 4 beer faucets and shank kits and used them to make a jockey box. They work great. we are very happy with our purchase and have recommended this company to others.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: great product good price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, they easily went through an old fridge door, cheap tap handles but plenty of other options out there, great value
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: basic, but good
customer_reviews.text: Basic tap, but it's cheap and works like a champ. The shank is the perfect lenght for a standard refridgerator door.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Have to keep tightening one of them as it leaks ...
customer_reviews.text: Have to keep tightening one of them as it leaks, but I don't think this is a default in product.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey K.

customer_reviews.title: Needs better quality control
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 of these and one was missing the entire faucet assembly. Needs better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Handle
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. Beer occasionally leaks out even though handle is closed. All beers poured from this handle are half foam as air is getting into the line.
customer_reviews.author: Chad TerWisscha

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for in order to make a cooler tap.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Everything works well, but the item does not come ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well, but the item does not come with the beer line nipple as shown in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Bought the, one leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. One faucet leaks. Looking for a manual or a design draft so I can figure out how to machine it to make it seal. Any help?
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Beertastic.
customer_reviews.text: Installed 4 in a collar for a keezer, super simple setup. Plan on changing out the plastic taps for something more ornate but they'll do nicely for now.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Kelly

customer_reviews.title: If I could go back I would have purchased a more expensive and more sturdy one but all in all I'm pleased with the ...
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly and does its job. If I could go back I would have purchased a more expensive and more sturdy one but all in all I'm pleased with the ease of instillation, look, and functionality of this tap.
customer_reviews.author: James B McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Good faucets
customer_reviews.text: Good faucets for the price. been using for a while now and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Drip
customer_reviews.text: Both of them drip. Sending back. Thanks for a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Watson

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my brother. I found it to be very heavy and good quality. He said it works great and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: swflpt

customer_reviews.title: Legit
customer_reviews.text: terrific! I even had the perlick in my shopping cart but after I read the reviews on this one I changed my mind. Spent half as much and its completely legit. Mine doesnt stick either, like the other reviews mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L Carson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our home made Kegerator mounted through a 2x4 wood. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: MCB_QC_inspector

customer_reviews.title: Love this tap.
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my kegerator, and it works great. This is just like a professional tap.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cofer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Seller made everything possible to meet my expectations. I am glad I bought this product from this seller. Now my kegerator look very impressive
customer_reviews.author: Leonel

customer_reviews.title: Use it every day!
customer_reviews.text: Great, solid, went together perfectly... If you run a basic set up, this is the way to go. I'll buy another when I need to do so...
customer_reviews.author: nicorellius

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for six months now without any trouble. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F.

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Drips.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price but not to be used without a drip tray. Does not "leak" but several drops will fall after closing the valve after every pour.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This faucet works great, but I really wish it had a spring-loaded shut-off feature. On the plus side, small children will pull the handle, run away, and drain your keg, which, while messy, is still pretty funny. As to quality, it looks fine and works fine. Doesn't leak, and is more than long enough to fit through the fridge door. This fit perfectly on the cheap plastic line that came with my keg kit; just needed a hose clamp to secure it, and it replaces the black plastic picnic tap perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Clements

customer_reviews.title: Should come with an o-ring
customer_reviews.text: It leaked at first, but I added an o-ring and it works perfectly now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice faucet
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty nice faucet - definitely worth the price. Only complaint was that the plastic flanges were broken with each of the 2 faucets I ordered. I just used a washer instead. Good otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: saturn5

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 2, both work very well, will buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Working Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these sets (very good price compared to other sites). They are very rigid and durable (heavy too, in a good way!). They also look great. I have since acquired tap handles, but the small black plastic ones they come with work great until you can upgrade! I run water through them when changing kegs, but other than that, have not had to do extensive cleaning due to binding or other issues. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sure they are not Perlicks, but hey they were 1/2 the price. They work great. They do stick just a bit if you don't pull a beer from them every day or so.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Phillips

customer_reviews.title: I like the faucet except the nipple is for a 1/4 ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the faucet except the nipple is for a 1/4 ID hose. It's too small a hose for most Homebrew setups. It's more for a Bar or pub with a VERY long run between the keg and the faucet. The nipple is welded to the shank, so to change it to the standard larger size, you have to buy a whole new shank. Other than that it's a decent Faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Junk, that worked well for a while but then leave like leaked everywhere
customer_reviews.text: After about two months this faucet leaked my entire length all over the floor. Fortunately I had already had a flood and the carpet had been removed or this would have caused hundreds in damage. Do yourself a favor and don't buy Todd cheap faucet. I have a buddy had had the same faucet and is having the same issue. I wouldn't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M. Wexler

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Saved time and money with this all in one kit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Small

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Installed them and they work. No complaints 3 months in.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Does with it says it does. My only complaint is the "throw" isn't very satisfying. The locking angle could be a little more aggressive. You have to really make sure you push it back closed and hold it a second to seal. I sometimes keep kegs not continuously hooked up to gas. As a result i have to re-pressurize on the fly. I've done this and had one of the taps open by itself due to the change in increased pressure. Feel the seal could be a smidge better but works well
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this is the handle action is very "easy". You hardly have to apply any pressure to pull the handle. I know it sounds strange but for a tap I don't want to accident hit it and it opens up. Otherwise it works, does not leak, and came very clean.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these when upgrading from a 1 faucet homemade kegerator to a 3 faucet homemade keezer. Bought based on price as I was already spending a lot on everything else needed for the build. Time will tell, but so far no problems and I can't really tell a difference between these and the Perlick that's installed on the kegerator the keezer is replacing.
customer_reviews.author: TimmyTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend For A Small Kegerator Build
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this faucet for a small kegerator build and no problems after over a year of use. Installation was easy and it works great! One note, the tap handle is a little bit small and wouldn't be able to accommodate a custom tap handle if you're looking to upgrade. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jason H Eggers

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and sticks
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2, and one sticks so badly I had to work it free for every glass poured, then work it closed before the glass overflowed. In frustration I tried to force it, now it is bent and USELESS. The other works pretty well minus an occasional mild stick and drip.
customer_reviews.author: Westring

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive Beer Faucet Set
customer_reviews.text: They do the job they were intended, but aren't quite as nice as Perlicks, but at half the cost of a comparable Perlick setup, they are fine for a home Kegerator or Keezer system. If I want to upgrade, I can still use the shanks to install Perlicks on them someday.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Nolte

customer_reviews.title: Professional and High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my freezer I converted to a keezer. Quality materials that come apart easily for cleaning. I've liked it enough to buy it a second time when I wanted to expand to a second tap. This feels like a heavy duty professional tap.
customer_reviews.author: G. Miller

customer_reviews.title: This works well, I'm a brewer and have others.
customer_reviews.text: I have other faucet's that cost more some not to name, names, but they start with a P and end with a 525. This works just as well and is much cheaper. The barb for the shank is not removable and the size is 1/4" standard beer line size. This is like the tap you see in most bars.
customer_reviews.author: mikescooling

customer_reviews.title: Fills my glass up with beer. Enough said.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my neighbor's beer brewing set-up that we are jointly funding within the neighborhood, because most of us like to drink beer. It brings the beer out of the beer fridge into my glass. I like this. This works well.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. GROSS

customer_reviews.title: Great taps!
customer_reviews.text: So far have bought two of these. On home kegerator. Very nice quality taps for the price. Doesn't leak at all except for a couple dribbles after pouring. Opens and closes nicely. Highly recommended after having these in service for the last 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tap, Easy Install.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fairly well. Easy install, looks sharp and pours great. Only complaint is that sometimes it does stick a bit, requiring just a bit more force in order to get it to open fully. Definitely get a tap brush and a tap soother for this thing, though. Keep 'er nice and shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Barker

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these types of taps.
customer_reviews.text: They will stick after a week of non use. Then you have to pry it open to pour beer. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: the other is fine. Will try to tighten the other one but ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the shanks seems to have a leak, the other is fine. Will try to tighten the other one but it seems fully tight, might want to look at another company.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good faucet. Like other reviews on here
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good faucet. Like other reviews on here, this does get a little sticky if you don't pull a beer from it on a daily basis, nothing to be really worried about though. I drilled my refridgerator with a 1 inch step drill and it slipped right in.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Faucet is perfect chrome, easy flowing
customer_reviews.text: Faucet is perfect chrome, easy flowing, no taste altering, and I like the simple handle that comes with it. Overall a nice, clean product with every part you need to just plug and play!
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good quality product. Unfortunately one of the couplers was missing from the delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive taps
customer_reviews.text: Works great and looks very similar to my existing taps. Needs to be cleaned weekly or else it gets sticky. Easy to clean, so, it's not that big of a deal. You should be cleaning your lines weekly anyways. I will/would buy more of these.
customer_reviews.author: DonniePHX

customer_reviews.title: It does the job. Definitely had it stick, ...
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Definitely had it stick, so maybe it's just time to clean it but it's my understanding that more expensive beer taps don't have that problem quite as much. Just ordered the tap soother so I'll see if it still sticks after that.
customer_reviews.author: Flori S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Installed in on the door of a fridge ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Installed in on the door of a fridge gives a better pour with less foaming then the plastic picnic tap.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: Son was happy!
customer_reviews.text: Son was happy! Now he can drink himself into a tizzy!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Leaks. Get a better one. I wish it didn't take me two months to build my kegorator or I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Catseye

customer_reviews.title: but otherwise its perfect.
customer_reviews.text: My only problem is that its hard to get tight enough. I can modify a couple things that might help, but otherwise its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M. Coale

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I dare you to find a better deal. Works super.
customer_reviews.author: Ted H.

customer_reviews.title: Good tap
customer_reviews.text: Great tap. Although the barb fitting is permanently connected to the shank - making it a little more difficult to disconnect to clean.
customer_reviews.author: DGnetiks

customer_reviews.title: Sticks after limited use.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, but have to clean it approximately every half keg because it sticks after low to moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryle Nilles

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. This is was exactly what I was looking for. I would recommend this buyer to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Working well so far. Just be aware that the ...
customer_reviews.text: Working well so far. Just be aware that the hose connection is a permanent part of the shank, and does not have a screw on tail piece.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on/off action
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a secondary tap on an older kegerator I purchased this past winter. It works so well I am going to order a couple more. This model gives very good control of your beer pour and looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: eojoob

customer_reviews.title: Good faucets for the price
customer_reviews.text: These were much cheaper than my local homebrew store, and they work great. No leaks or issues, easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Anderson

customer_reviews.title: easy to install in my spare fridge to make a keggerator
customer_reviews.text: part came quickly, it was easy to install, one hole in the door of my fridge and this draft faucet was soon dispencing my favorite brew.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: nice look, we'll see how well the valve holds ...
customer_reviews.text: works well, nice look, we'll see how well the valve holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Martin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid build. No locking mechanism, easy to bump and spill...
customer_reviews.author: Luke Ettinger

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: They are shanks with taps and handles. Everything fit great and worked perfectly as expected. They pour my homebrew just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vincencio Sempronio

customer_reviews.title: They worked good just seemed cheap
customer_reviews.text: The Black handles looked scuffed. They worked good just seemed cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H.

customer_reviews.title: great product, super easy to install with the proper ...
customer_reviews.text: great product, super easy to install with the proper drillbit and works like a charm. attractive, no leaks, fits great on my fridge1
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: nice taps
customer_reviews.text: pours beer. much better than picinc taps i was using. good quality so far. doesn't drip too long after pour
customer_reviews.author: yup

customer_reviews.title: Works good, but sticks...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if all faucets stick, but this one does if it is not used for a few days. I haven't figured out a way to get it unstuck other than brute force, but once it's broke loose, the beer pours fine. I'll keep it but I'm not sure if I would order another one.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I've been drinking homebrew out of these for a couple months now and couldn't be happier. Get yourself a spray bottle to clean out the tips at the end of the night, makes the first beer tomorrow better.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but flow through valve is very small
customer_reviews.text: This is very well built and sturdy, and if used for pure liquids (beer, soda, etc) it will work perfectly. I used this for a watermelon punch in the watermelon, and the pulp often clogged the flow through, so I had to clean it several time during the party.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Weatherby

customer_reviews.title: easy to disassemble and clean
customer_reviews.text: I'm sporting 4 of these now in my keezer. They seal well, easy to disassemble and clean, and are of great quality. Some people complain about stickiness, but I have not experienced any more stickiness than with any other brand. Unless you get perlicks, there will be some stickiness with this design. But there's also a work around... drink your beer faster!
customer_reviews.author: B.P.

customer_reviews.title: Better for light beers!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to get stuck and partially clogs with ipa or the Irish red I made. I think any light beer will work fine but once you put anything through it with more sugar content, you may run into issues. I heard perlicks are not this way so I'll probably upgrade once I get p*ssed enough!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Vandy

customer_reviews.title: Would have been a 5 star if any type of instructions were included.
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a 5 star if any type of instructions were included. Otherwise works like a charm. I already had a faucet wrench but if you don't you will need one so you don't scratch your chrome.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan
